intro: Aster floribundus, commonly known as the garden aster, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually hairy as well. Aster floribundus is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
